answerText: electronegativity[10] Interestingly, it is this atom rather than fluorine which has the highest electronegativity according to the Mulliken scale and the Allen scale. This is the lightest element with a full p shell.

question: Question: This measure is the average of ionization energy and electron affinity according to one scale, and it is linear in the effective nuclear charge in the AllredÂ–Rochow scale. For 10 points each: [10] Name this measure first defined by Linus Pauling to quantify an atom's tendency to pull electrons to it when in a bond.
